intro: Allosorus gracilis, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its slender, multi-branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in spring, followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods that split open to release seeds. Allosorus gracilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
